meanings.definition: A punishment imposed for breaking a law or rule.
meanings.sent1: The referee gave a penalty for the foul.
meanings.sent2: He had to pay a penalty for speeding.
meanings.sent3: Getting a penalty for not finishing his vegetables made him pout.
meanings.sent4: The penalty for cheating in the game was sitting out the next round.
meanings.sent5: The penalty for arriving late to work was having to stay extra hours.

meanings.definition: A disadvantage or loss incurred as a result of an action.
meanings.sent1: Missing the bus was a penalty for oversleeping.
meanings.sent2: There was a penalty for not studying for the test.
meanings.sent3: The penalty for forgetting his lunch was a grumbling stomach.
meanings.sent4: The penalty of losing the game was disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The penalty of not wearing sunscreen was a painful sunburn.

meanings.definition: A fee or fine imposed for not following a contract or agreement.
meanings.sent1: There was a penalty for canceling the reservation last minute.
meanings.sent2: He had to pay a penalty for returning the equipment late.
meanings.sent3: The penalty for breaking the rental agreement was an extra charge.
meanings.sent4: The penalty for exceeding the data limit was an additional fee.
meanings.sent5: The penalty for not paying the bill on time was a late fee.
